availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: In the case of the Commonwealth of Kentucky against Beauchamp I desire if I am not here at court on the day of trial to have said case dismissed. I am now well and in the service of the United States and if Beauchamp did me an injury or I him. I desire to have the cause dismissed and have no further notice taken of the whole matter, he being arraigned for having cut me with a knife. This I desire for the Commonwealth's Attorney and to be filed in the papers.
Given under my hand this 14th day of July 1862

Attest
G, Pickrell
M. M. Teager
J. Raincraft

State of Kentucky
Fleming Circut Sct
I certify the foregoing to be a true copy of the statement of John Keithly filed in my office with the papers in the case of the Commonwealth against William S. Beauchamp.

John M. Harbeson Clerk
Fleming Circuit Court
